statement:
For a , parameterized curve $\alpha\colon (a,b)\to\mathbb R^3$, not
necessarily unit speed, the curvature $\kappa(t)$ and torsion $\tau(t)$
are given, respectively, by $$\begin{aligned}
\kappa(t)&=\frac{\|\alpha'(t)\times\alpha''(t)\|}{\|\alpha'(t)\|^3};\\
\tau(t)&=\frac{(\alpha'(t)\times\alpha''(t))\cdot\alpha'''(t)}{\|\alpha'(t)\times\alpha''(t)\|^2}.\end{aligned}$$

John McCleary, *Geometry from a Differentiable Viewpoint*, Cambridge
University Press, 1994.
